abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey a satisfactory
            outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. Despite a well designed
            program, with necessary and feasible policy actions, the
            project had to be cancelled due to implementation
            restrictions in areas not expected during preparation.
            Lessons suggest the following. When cross-linking
            conditionalities between different development policy loans,
            it is not only important to evaluate the financial
            leveraging impact, but also the potential problems that may
            arise if reforms move at different speeds. Furthermore, the
            solid prior understanding of the sectors involved in the
            operation facilitates the preparation and achievements of
            the Program. Continuous dialogue with official counterparts
            and independent analysts, simplified the team's work
            during preparation, as the main sectors and policies to be
            supported were clearly identified. Finally, the close and
            frequent supervision increased sustainability of programs,
            in spite of the crisis period and government changes.
            Despite the difficult economic and social situation in
            Uruguay, and the frequent changes of ministers and staff,
            the proactive supervision and sustained dialogue with the
            Ministry of Economy and Finance (MEF) and sector authorities
            facilitated the support of the program by all counterparts.
